Defining-and-calling-a-function_key1: The declaration of a function starts with the function keyword, followed by the name of the function you want to create, followed by parentheses i.e. ().
Defining-and-calling-a-function_key2: Function naming can follow all rules as variables.
Defining-and-calling-a-function_key3:
The parentheses may include parameter names separated by commas:
(parameter1, parameter2, …)

Defining-and-calling-a-function_key9: Once a function is defined it can be called (invoked) from anywhere in the document, by typing its name followed by a set of parentheses, like sayHello() in the example above this is how we call a function.
Defining-and-calling-a-function_key11: The above code is the example of function. The js function keyword helps us to define a function. The parameter name is like a variable which will take the argument we passed to the function as a value. Return is a keyword which stores the value of a function and gives the value whenever we call the function like console.log(sayHello("Pragna")).
Defining-and-calling-a-function_key12: This code output will be Hello Pragna because we are returning Hello with name and name is having Pragna as a value.
